info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 10:27PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Rutherford, eastern Polk and northwestern Spartanburg Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1027 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Rutherfordton, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Landrum, Green Creek, Fingerville and Mill Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
